hero.title: Preserving Ancient Crafts
hero.subtitle: Embracing Modern Aesthetics
hero.description: Hui Embroidery combines traditional Xiang embroidery with contemporary aesthetics, creating haute couture artworks that honor heritage while embracing innovation, showcasing the precious value of world intangible cultural heritage.

awards: 1987: 'Tang Dynasty Polo' and 'Chime Bell Dance' won National Arts & Crafts Hundred Flowers Award Gold Medal
1989: Multi-panel heterogeneous embroidery 'Li Qingzhao' won World Expo Gold Medal
1990: 'Kimono Belt' won Ministry of Light Industry Hundred Flowers Award Gold Medal
2002: Designed and embroidered 'Bush Family Portrait' as a gift to President Bush and his wife
2014: 'Oak Forest' won China International Cultural Industries Fair Hundred Flowers Award Gold Medal
2016: Participated in Taiwan Craft Development Association exhibition, work won Special Excellence Gold Award

master.title: Master's Profile
master.subtitle: International Embroidery Master Mao Hui
master.description: Hui Embroidery was founded by international embroidery master Mao Hui, focusing on the inheritance and innovation of Xiang embroidery art, providing unique haute couture embroidery services for high-end clients. Master Mao Hui comes from an embroidery family, studied under Asia-Pacific master and Chinese arts and crafts master Zhou Jinxiu, possesses over 30 years of exquisite skills, and is the third-generation inheritor of the unique Xiang embroidery technique "fine hair stitch".
master.description2: Her works have won international awards repeatedly and are highly praised by collectors and art lovers worldwide. In embroidery themes such as figures, animals, flowers and birds, and landscapes, Master Mao Hui is good at bold innovation, developing new stitches based on traditional techniques to enhance the artistry and liveliness of her works.
master.techniqueDesc: Third-generation inheritor of the fine hair stitch technique, able to delicately express animal fur and human hair in embroidery, making works more vivid and three-dimensional.

footer.description: Inheriting thousand-year embroidery craftsmanship, interpreting Oriental artistic spirit with modern aesthetics, committed to helping more people understand and appreciate the beauty of Chinese traditional culture.
